definition: Zhou Yu or Chou Yü (175-210), famous general of the southern Wu kingdom and victor of the battle of Redcliff/in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, absolutely no match for Zhuge Liang
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
excellence/luster of gems

fig. with the connivance of both sides/fig. by mutual consent/cf Wu patriot Huang Gai submits to mock beating at the hands of General Zhou Yu to deceive Cao Cao 曹操 before the 208 battle of Redcliff 赤壁之戰|赤壁之战[Chi4 bi4 zhi1 zhan4]

sentences.english: Sun then remembered his brother's words and asked the servant to send for Chou Yu at once.
sentences.chinese: 一句話提醒了孫權，馬上派人到鄱陽請周瑜來。

sentences.english: Zhou Yu cried out, and his wound reopened.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜大叫一聲，金瘡迸裂。

sentences.english: The next day, Zhou Yu sounded the drums, convening a general assembly of his commanders outside his tent.
sentences.chinese: 次日，周瑜鳴鼓大會諸將於帳下。

sentences.english: At last, Zhou Yu gave Huang Gai one hundred strokes on the back with a whip as punishment.
sentences.chinese: 最後，周瑜罰他挨一百軍棍。

sentences.english: Rapidly, Zhou Yu managed to rein back, but he was shot in the left rib and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜急勒馬回時，被一弩箭，正射中左肋，翻身落馬。

sentences.english: You want to know who she is?She is my sister, her name is Zhou Yu hu.
sentences.chinese: 你想知道她是誰嗎？她就是我的妹妹，她叫周瑜胡。

sentences.english: Please spare his life this time. " Without waiting for Kan Ning to finish, Chou Yu ordered his guards to beat him."
sentences.chinese: 周瑜不等他說完，叫衛士們一陣亂棒把甘寧打了出去。

sentences.english: Drool with envy to little Joe , hence the week Yu moved to kill the heart of various Ge.
sentences.chinese: 對於小喬垂涎三尺，於是周瑜就動了殺諸葛的心。

sentences.english: The next day, Chou Yu deployed 30,000 of his best soldiers by both water and land.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，周瑜調兵遣將，指揮三萬精銳，水陸並進。

definition: Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty

Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
Cheng Yu (141-220), advisor to General Cao Cao 曹操 during the Three Kingdoms era
